column4: you don't specify modules in grub; are you just trying to install grub on another partition?

darolu, actually i have xp on sda1, rhel5 on sda2 and ubuntu on sda3. And i just want to use chainload in RHEL's grub 0.97. RHEL's grub is in /dev/sda and thats why i was trying to install grub2 of ubuntu in /dev/sda3 but it says "Auto-detection of the filesystem module failed. Please specify the module with the option `--modules' explicitly."
you don't need to install grub to sda3 if you are chainloading...
but grub 0.97 doesn't support ext4 filesystem.
Ah: there's the rub... Now I see your dilema
upgrading RHEL to grub 2 not an option?
i tried but no its not possible then someone got me remembered about chainloading thats why i was trying it....Can you jsut tell me how can i specify modules in grub while installing???
i m trying, if i am successfull in that then will notify you....:)
is there any command to check filesystem of the current system??
it doen't show the filesystem but i get info by checking the partition  properties...:)
my bad - that would be mount :)
yeah it happens sometimes....:) but you stil a PRO....:)
ok buddy i m going for reboot.....bbye...:)
